stories.text: The sun is setting as you arrive at a village. An elderly woman offers you a room in her hut to sleep in. You wake up to the soft glow of a lightning bug flying around you.

conclusion.text: You catch the bug in a cup from the nightstand. You admire it for a second before it transforms into a vampire. You tie the monster up as a present to the villagers.
You try to catch the bug, but it’s too fast. It escapes out the window.

stories.text: A sixth sense wakes you from your dreams. There’s a single firefly dancing around you. The bug’s light may be subtle, but it’s keeping you awake.

conclusion.text: The bug lands on the wall. You grab your shoe from the floor and strike it. Direct hit! When you pull your shoe back the bug flies away unharmed.

stories.text: A small village is in chaos. You ask what is wrong and discover that the chief’s wife was bit by an Adze and is now possessed. They ask if you can help.

conclusion.text: The villager leads you to the chief’s hut. You perform a ritual to draw the evil spirit out of the woman. It takes hours and leaves you exhausted, but you do it.
You tell them you will try your best. When you enter, the chief’s wife throws everything she can reach, driving you away.

stories.text: You want to explore the deeper parts of a forest, and you hear of hunters with great, magical skills that can lead you through the woods.

conclusion.text: You persuade one of the hunters to guide you through the trees. The trip goes perfectly, and you bring back plenty of goods from the forest.
Unable to find a guide, you set off into the deeper parts of the forest by yourself. You become hopelessly lost, until a hunting party finds you and leads you back to the village.

stories.text: You want to go hunting in the forest, but you hear warnings of mischievous creatures called eloko. You decide to go on anyway.

conclusion.text: You get a magical amulet from the village and head into the forest. Bells ring in your ears, but you resist the noise. You find and shoot a great buck, then head back.
You head into the forest, but you can’t find any animals.  Suddenly, you hear the sound of bells. The sound lures you even deeper into the forest, and become lost.

stories.text: You hear that the eloko are the spirits of the villagers’ ancestors. You decide to calm them by making an offering in the hopes that they will leave the villagers alone.

conclusion.text: You make an offering of animal meat from the forest, which seems to satisfy the eloko. They agree to leave the villagers alone.
You offer the eloko a selection of fruit and bread from the village, but they are displeased. They threaten to eat you instead, but you run away before they can catch you.

stories.text: The fat of the Impundulu is said to have healing powers. The village witch doctor asks you to trap the bird and get some fat from it.

conclusion.text: Lightning strikes the ground, and you rush over to the spot. The Impundulu is lying on the ground, dazed. You cut off some fat for the witch doctor, then run away.
Lightning strikes, and you run as fast as you can to the Impundulu. You are not quick enough, however, and the bird flies away. You return to the village empty-handed.

stories.text: You have heard tales that the Impundulu lays a large egg underground, and those who find it will have good luck. You decide to search for it.

conclusion.text: You go to the location of the lightning strike and dig underground for the egg, but you accidentally break it. This is a bad omen, and will surely bring you bad luck.
You dig in the sand and find the egg. You carefully lift it out of the hole and bring it back to the village. Such a rare find will surely bring you good fortune.

stories.text: You are walking through the desert when an Impundulu swoops down, bearing its talons. It looks like it is going to attack you.

conclusion.text: You summon a huge fireball and throw it at the Impundulu. It’s a direct hit, and the beast lets out a scream as it flies away.
You pull out a knife and slash at the creature, but it ignores the attack. It claws you as it swoops down, and you fall. The creature flies off and leaves you alone.

stories.text: You walk along a section of the Great Wall of China. Something massive flies above you, creating a thunderstorm that is scaring everyone in the area.

conclusion.text: You’ve heard that these types of dragons are the mortal enemies of tigers, so you cast a spell to summon a giant tiger. The dragon sees it and the two become locked in battle.
You try to frighten the monster off by shooting arrows at it with your bow, but this only makes it mad. It swoops down and grabs the bow from your hands. You run away.

stories.text: This dragon is causing a huge storm at the Great Wall of China. Dragons are known for being greedy, and you might just have something it wants.

conclusion.text: You’ve heard that these types of dragons revere a mystical flaming pearl. You bribe the dragon with a regular pearl in exchange for stopping the storm.
You yell to get the dragon’s attention and try to offer it your wallet. But all you have is paper money, and dragons like gold. Your wallet blows away and the storm continues.

stories.text: An old Chinese legend says that there is a magical waterfall called The Dragon Gate. If a carp manages to leap over it, they become a dragon. You want to know if it’s true.

conclusion.text: You spend weeks training your carp. Finally, you think it is strong enough. You go to The Dragon Gate and watch you carp leap over the waterfall. It emerges as a dragon!
You search high and low for The Dragon Gate and a carp. You find a waterfall, but all you can get is a goldfish. You watch it swim around happily, but nothing happens.

stories.text: As you’re sitting on the edge of a river, you see a large turtle swimming towards you. When it gets close it launches from the water to reveal it’s not a turtle, but a kappa!

conclusion.text: Remembering Japanese manners, you give the kappa a greeting bow. It returns your bow, emptying the water-filled dip on its head. It loses its strength and crawls to the water.
The kappa stares at you, confused, as you wave at it. Without warning it tackles you and tries to drag you into the river. You manage to free yourself and flee.

stories.text: The heat of the day is getting to you and you decide to splash some water from the nearby river on your face. As you kneel, you’re ambushed by something in the currents.

conclusion.text: You draw your blade, and the kappa hisses at you. It seems more disgusted at the metal you’re wielding than it is of you. It backs away, returning to the water.
You run to your backpack and pull out the first thing you grab. It’s a cucumber; you throw it at the Kappa. It catches the cucumber. It seems happy as it returns to the water.

stories.text: Nearby villagers have selected you to seek out the water spirit. Many villagers are sick, and the spirit is said to know ancient healing techniques.

conclusion.text: The kappa returns to the river. You think you’ve failed until you see its shell coming back. It hands you a giant Scroll of Healing to take to the village.
The kappa watches you plead for its help, but without an offering it refuses and leaves you kneeling on the edge of river.

stories.text: You’ve heard that at the bottom of the rivers and oceans, there are places filled with immortal snake people that live in giant, jeweled palaces.

conclusion.text: You dive and swim to the bottom of the river. You see the giant jeweled palace with the snake people swimming around it. You need air and have to leave.
The river is stronger than you thought. You struggle to stay above water. A hand grabs you and takes you to shore. You see the tail of a snake swimming into the water.

stories.text: You seek shelter from the drenching rains of a monsoon. You see a man under a canopy. As you get closer, you realize that the canopy is a giant snake.

conclusion.text: You sneak under the snake, careful not to catch its attention. You watch the man and realize he’s deep in meditation and doesn’t realize you’re there, either.
The snake warns you that if you disturb the man he’s protecting, it will devour you. You promise you will be quiet and scurry out of the rain.

stories.text: You come to a temple, seeking water and shelter from the sun. The monks let you rest but have no water to spare, due to a drought.

conclusion.text: As you rest in the shade of the temple you see a eagle block out the sun and rain clouds appear. You run outside and dance in the rain, shouting praise to the eagle.

stories.text: As you trudge through a swamp, you hear a howl that sends shivers down your spine. Wasting no time, you dive for cover.

conclusion.text: You conceal yourself in muck and shrubs. You watch from your hiding place as a giant amphibious dog walks right past you.
You try to cover yourself in mud and plants, but when the creature passes, you accidentally scream. You abandon your cover and run.

stories.text: You’re trekking through a swamp. You start to get a sense that something, other than the bugs biting your arm, is following you. You turn to see a large shadow trailing you.

conclusion.text: The beast realizes it has been spotted and charges. There’s barely enough time to draw your sword and fend off the creature.
You don’t have any weapons, but you grab a thick branch as the beast charges you. You dodge its bite and smack the monster on its head. Dazed, it flees back into the swamp.

stories.text: The locals warn you to avoid the swamps. When you ask why, they tell you of a giant dog-like creature that attacks anyone who trespasses.

conclusion.text: You use your magic to look through the eyes of a bird. It doesn’t take long to spot the giant creature. It’s a wonderfully terrifying sight.
A monster like that is exactly what you need for your book. You decide to brave the swamp. You find the creature napping in the trail. You watch it until it wakes.

stories.text: You paddle your boat through a dark, gloomy river. Something moves underneath you and grabs your boat. The villagers warned you about this river guardian.

conclusion.text: You’ve heard stories about people leaving offerings for the taniwha that guard their villages. You give the creature a traditional green twig and sweet potato.
You try to think of a good present for the monster, but all you have is your lunch. The monster turns up his nose at your tuna sandwich and swims away, offended.

stories.text: As you paddle your small boat through a river, you notice a Taniwha digging on the shore.

conclusion.text: You’ve heard that Taniwha sometimes create harbours by carving-out channels in rivers. You come back every day to watch it work, until it finally finishes its masterpiece.
You assume that the creature is looking for something, so you get down on your hands and knees and dig beside it. The monster gets angry at you and growls; you paddle away.

stories.text: You see the yowie up ahead, skulking around in the grass. It hasn’t noticed you yet, so you decide to sit back and watch what it does.

conclusion.text: You stand perfectly still. You watch as the yowie hunts a rabbit, then begins to feast. After a while, it walks away, and you leave the forest behind.
You try to be quiet, but you accidentally snap a branch and the yowie notices you. It runs toward you, and you manage to escape.

stories.text: The yowie turns toward you and makes a series of grunts and whoops. It sounds like it is trying to communicate with you, so you try your best to answer.

conclusion.text: You try to match the yowie’s calls and succeed. It grabs some berries from a nearby bush and stomps up to you. It drops the berries at your feet, then runs off into the trees.
You wave your arms at the yowie, and it becomes startled. It begins to gather twigs and rocks off the ground and pelts them at you. You dodge the flying objects and run away.

stories.text: The yowie starts to climb a tree up ahead of you. You work your way over to a nearby tree and try to outpace it.

conclusion.text: Your hands and feet move like lightning as you scale branch after branch. Soon enough, you watch the yowie from above as it climbs the tree, then heads back to the ground.
You try to race the yowie up the tree, but you struggle to get your footing on the branches. Eventually, you fall out of the tree and hit the ground, disappointed.

stories.text: The wraith stares at you from within a lonely graveyard. It seems like it wants something from you, but you aren’t sure. Perhaps there’s something you can do for it.

conclusion.text: The ghost points a bony finger at a lonely patch of soil. You gather some flowers and place them on the grave. The creature seems satisfied, and disappears.
You see no way to pay respect for the dead in this cold, dark place. The wraith becomes angry and lets out a piercing shriek. You run away before it can do anything else.

stories.text: The wraith appears in the center of the old graveyard, but it hasn’t noticed you yet. You decide to watch it, and step closer to get a better look.

conclusion.text: You creep closer to the wraith and watch as it floats among the tombstones. Dozens of tiny orbs of light appear around the wraith. You watch them until the sun comes up.
As you step forward, your foot snaps a branch in two. The wraith notices you, and lets out a loud wail. The wraith vanishes, and its howl rings in your ears.

stories.text: The wraith looks angry as it thrashes around the graves. You decide to try and communicate with the ghostly figure in order to help it move on.

conclusion.text: You call out to the wraith and it turns toward you. You begin to talk to it, and after a while you convince it to leave the graveyard in peace.
You try to speak to the wraith, but your words fail to calm it down. A thick fog covers the graveyard, and you run away before anything else happens.

stories.text: You arrive at the shore of a vast lake. The water ripples softly in the moonlight. The ripples move closer and a creature emerges. Everyone around you pulls out their cameras.

conclusion.text: You quietly explain to the monster that if she continues entertaining people, they will never leave her alone. She cackles like a dolphin and slowly slips back into the water.
You try to convince Nessie that she should go back into hiding, but she’s distracted by the cameras. She swims up to one photographer and gives him a giant smile.

stories.text: You’ve heard that hunters have been trying to catch the Loch Ness Monster. The locals don’t know what to do. You think you can help her escape.

conclusion.text: You get the locals to help clear a path from the lake to the ocean. You lure Nessie on to land, and run with her all the way, making sure she doesn’t get hurt.
The locals help you clear a path from the lake to the ocean, but you’re too slow to keep up with Nessie as she runs. Instead, she lets you ride on her back!

stories.text: As you rest in a local restaurant, you hear that some townspeople are thinking about attacking the Loch Ness Monster. You decide you want to help her escape.

conclusion.text: Three spheres of light swirl around the monster’s head and chase Nessie down into the water. You hope she will escape through the large crevice at the bottom of the lake.
You run straight at the monster, yelling and waving your arms, but she doesn’t seem to care. You watch her swim around for a while before she dives under the water.

stories.text: You stand on a beach, watching it flail. This thing is so big, you can hardly see its face behind its massive tentacles. There’s no way it can catch you.

conclusion.text: You sprint to a nearby lighthouse. When the monster strikes, you dive out of the way. The tentacle hits the lighthouse and is sliced in half.
You try to run, but trip and fall on your face. Is that thing laughing at you? It picks you up in one of its tentacles and sets you on your feet, and swims away, entertained.

stories.text: You stand on a fishing boat in the middle of the ocean. The monster is determined to flip your boat over. You can’t tell if it’s angry, or just hungry.

conclusion.text: You release all of your fish back into the water, hoping to make the monster happy. It quickly gobbles them up and swims away.
You try to offer it a slice of pizza, but the creature ignores you. Instead, it grabs your first mate, and swallows him whole! The Kraken disappears back into the water.

stories.text: The creature is ahead of you, stomping around in the grass. You decide to hang back and observe it from a distance.

conclusion.text: You stand perfectly still, making sure not to move a muscle. You watch as the cockatrice snaps up a nearby rabbit. What a magnificent sight!
You lay down on the ground, but the creature notices you. You quickly look the other way to avoid its gaze, then bolt away from the scene.

stories.text: You hear the cockatrice shuffle around and stomp toward you. You only have a moment to react before it will reach you.

conclusion.text: You know that the cockatrice hates its reflection. You pull out a small mirror and hold it behind your back. The cockatrice screams and runs away.
You don’t know what you can do to defend against the cockatrice. Seeing no other options, you decide to run away from the monster.

stories.text: The cockatrice lets out a mighty roar and runs toward you. You snap your eyes shut to avoid its gaze, then act.

conclusion.text: You summon a blinding flash of light. The cockatrice screams and scuttles off, clearly annoyed. You open your eyes to find yourself alone in the grassy field.
You pull out a knife and slash blindly, but it’s no use. The cockatrice attacks, and you find yourself unable to move. The monster leaves, but you stay frozen for a few hours.

stories.text: You are dancing around a fire to tribal music. You see a woman hiding on the forest’s edge and invite her to join.

conclusion.text: As the woman nears, you notice she doesn’t have feet, but deer hooves. You look away and let her enjoy a night of dancing.
The woman’s deer hooves grab your attention. Your stares make her embarrassed and uncomfortable. She runs back to the woods. Something in the forest now feels threatening.

stories.text: You notice a woman watching you from the edge of a forest. Curious, you follow the woman into the forest. You catch up to her in a small clearing. She turns into a large deer and attacks.

conclusion.text: You fend off the deer with a fallen branch as you back out of the forest.

stories.text: You spot a spirit in the trees. A local tribe is about to die out since its women can’t get pregnant. Perhaps the spirit can aid them.

conclusion.text: Deer woman are known to help women conceive. You persuade the spirit to aid the women of the village to get pregnant.
The spirit doesn’t seem to hear you, instead she stares the drums left by the fireside. You go over to them and play them for her. She smiles and begins to dance.

stories.text: The village has had a shortage of food lately, and people are starving. They are concerned that someone might resort to cannibalism and become a wendigo.

conclusion.text: You gather some villagers and go on a hunting trip. You all move quietly through the forest and hunt a lot of animals. You bring back enough meat to last the winter.
You find people to help you hunt, but everyone makes a lot of noise and scares all the animals away. You come back to the village empty-handed, and everyone is sad.

stories.text: While travelling, you find a wendigo wandering about, looking for a meal. The creature spies you and gets ready to attack. If you don’t act, you will be its next meal.

conclusion.text: You summon a huge ball of fire and fling it at the creature. It screams in agony as it is burned, and quickly runs away from you.
You try to attack the creature, but your punches do nothing. It slashes you with its claws, but you are rescued by a group of villagers walking along the road.

stories.text: You decide to hunt for caribou at a local forest. However, as you hunt, you feel like you are being watched. Out of the corner of your eye, you see an ijiraq.

conclusion.text: You manage to follow the trail back to camp, even as the ijiraq tries its best to confuse you. As you reach your campfire, the ijiraq slips away and leaves you alone.
You search for a way to get back to camp, but the ijiraq’s influence takes hold and you wander the ice for a while. When you finally get back, you are cold and tired.

stories.text: On the way to your camp, you see a child wandering northward. He looks like he is being led by an unseen force. You run to him and offer to help, and an angry ijiraq attacks you.

conclusion.text: You summon a ball of lightning and blast it at the ijiraq. It shrieks and disappears, and you lead the lost child back to safety.
You pull out a knife and slash at the ghost, but the blade passes right through it. A fog clouds your mind, and you and the child wander the ice until help arrives.

stories.text: You are exploring the icy tundra, far north of civilization, and you soon become lost in the endless white. You feel a nearby presence, and decide to ask the ijiraq for help.

conclusion.text: You manage to persuade the ijiraq to help you out. It leads you the safety of your camp, then disappears with a cackle.
The ijiraq leads you through the snow and you end up at its lair. You realize that you are in danger. You manage to slip away and find your way back, alone.

stories.text: The sun sets on the small goat farm you promised to guard. Everything seems ok, until one of the goats suddenly drops dead. A creature the size of a small bear grins at you.

conclusion.text: You go to the farmer’s house and work out an agreement with the villagers: every day, one person will set out food or meat for the monster. The monster agrees.
You run back to the farmer’s house and try to convince the villagers to make peace with the monster, but they refuse. You watch them try to catch the monster all morning.

stories.text: A village asks you to help them catch a creature that has been terrorizing their goat farms. You wait until the creature appears at sunset.

conclusion.text: You summon a fiery cage to trap the monster in. In the morning, you organize a meeting with the town to figure out a peaceful solution.
You run at the monster and try to grab it, but it hops away like a kangaroo and escapes into the night.

stories.text: You watch the chupacabra kill goats and suck their blood. You can’t let it keep killing all of the village’s livestock.

conclusion.text: You summon your courage and leap at the monster. It’s fast, but you are much stronger. You wrestle it to the ground and keep it pinned long enough for help to arrive.
You try to attack the monster, but it suddenly shapeshifts into a hairless dog and leaps away. People have blamed chupacabra sightings on these dogs, but now you know the truth.

stories.text: You come across a pasture of deformed cattle. You ask the shepherd what what is wrong with them. He thinks there is a creature that keeps getting in the pastures at night.

conclusion.text: You volunteer to help capture the creature. You hide in a bush and wait. A large cow-like creature emerges from the river. You sneak up behind it and catch it in a net.
You and the shepherd tie a cow to a tree at sunset. You both hide in the distance and watch. When a creature emerges from the water you both run it down and catch it.

stories.text: In your travels, you meet a pregnant woman who is sitting on the side of the road crying. She explains that she got too close to a creature that cursed her child.

conclusion.text: You calm the woman and explain that you can help her. You can barely get her to sit still long enough to remove the curse from her.
You spend time with the woman, trying to calm her. When she is done crying she smiles and rubs her belly. She says she will love her baby no matter what.

stories.text: You wander through the remains of a burnt forest. You find a woman crying by a dead tree.The Madremonte tells you that this forest was destroyed by a wildfire.

conclusion.text: The madremonte tells you that none of the locals have done anything to help. You call a meeting with them and convince them to help regrow the forest.
None of the locals will help the creature, so you help her plot her revenge. The two of you set a trap outside the village; when it triggers, the village burns to the ground.

stories.text: As you hack your way through the dense forest, you are suddenly attacked by a madremonte.

conclusion.text: You throw her off of your back and slice at her with your machete. She manages to escape, but not before you get in a couple hits.
You kick and scream as she pins you down and claws at your face. You both hear shouting in the distance; she runs away just as a group of hunters arrive to save you.

stories.text: While you camp in the forest, a madremonte appears and sits by your fire. She informs you that the forest is shrinking, and that soon the animals will starve.

conclusion.text: You agree to help her plant more trees. The two of you work for days, until finally the forest is lush and beautiful again.
